ThingDef.label: mareep
ThingDef.description: A medium-sized sheep like electro Pokemon. Clothing made from Mareep's fleece is easily charged with static electricity, so a special process is used on it.

ThingDef.label: houndour
ThingDef.description: It cooperates with others skillfully. When it becomes your partner, it's very loyal to you as its Trainer and will obey your orders.

ThingDef.label: larvitar
ThingDef.description: Born underground, it eats its way through dirt to the surface, where its parents are. It doesn't deal well with the bright light it finds there.

ThingDef.label: magnemite
ThingDef.description: It's frequently the cause of power outages, which is why some power plants send out electrical signals that it can't stand.

ThingDef.label: magneton
ThingDef.description: Delicate equipment can malfunction in areas inhabited by Magneton, which send out mysterious electrical signals.

ThingDef.label: magnezone
ThingDef.description: There are still people who believe that this Pokémon came from outer space. It emanates a powerful magnetic field.

ThingDef.label: grimer
ThingDef.description: Appears in filthy areas. It thrives by sucking up polluted sludge that is pumped out of factories.

ThingDef.label: muk
ThingDef.description: This Pokémon's favorite food is anything that is repugnantly filthy. In dirty towns where people think nothing of throwing away litter on the streets, Muk are certain to gather.

ThingDef.label: tauros
ThingDef.description: They live in groups. The one with the longest, thickest, and most-scarred horns is the boss of the herd.

ThingDef.label: Doduo
ThingDef.description: Doduo's two heads never sleep at the same time. Its two heads take turns sleeping, so one head can always keep watch for enemies while the other one sleeps.

ThingDef.label: ekans
ThingDef.description: Ekans curls itself up in a spiral while it rests. Assuming this position allows it to quickly respond to a threat from any direction with a glare from its upraised head.
